The bell rang and students didn't lose any time to flood the high school's corridors.

"Ok, dear students. Don't forget to study chapters six and seven of your history book for next week" said a teacher, hoping her words would reach the teenagers' ears.

Said teacher was a busty African-American young woman with long black hair tied into a ponytail. She was wearing a formal dark jacket over a white shirt and a pair of black pants. Her name was Marcie Smithers, the newest teacher of Valentine's high school.

Marcie's wide brown eyes gazed at the students, hoping at least one could've given her a nod that they heard her. Thankfully, there was her pupil, Amanda Brown.

"No, problem Ms. Smithers" said the young redhead.

With that, Marcie could've come home with a smile.

-----

In her apartment, she found one of her roomates, May Swift, sleeping on the couch, with an animated movie on tv and an half eaten bowl of chips in her arms.

It was the usual, that girl would just rest her butt on the couch and get up only when it was time to sleep. If she had a job so she could've contributed to the expenses, she wouldn't have much problems with that.
She checked April's room, but it was Friday, meaning that the redhead was at work.

Marcie went to her bedroom without bothering about waking up May, when she was sleeping, not even an explosion could wake her up, picked the papers from her case and organized them on the desk. Her bedroom was fairly simple and tidy, everything was in its own place, from her numerous clothes in her wardrobe, to the books on the shelves above the desk and the bed.
She looked at the time on her phone and decided she would've prepared the test the next day.

Marcie prepared her gym bag and left the apartment. May was still sleeping. The dark-skinned woman thought she was a little more of a piece of furniture at that point.

----

Valentine's gym was pretty famous in the area, though not as much as some of the town's restaurants, and had multiple fitness classes. Marcie discovered it not long after she moved in Valentine, and quickly became one of its most famous customers.

Marcie had just finished working out, and went to the locker room. She greeted the other two women who were about to have a shower, after being a regular for all that time, Marcie had known almost every client of the gym.

She looked at the phone, and saw a message, it was from April:

"Hi Marcie, are you home tonight? May and I are planning a movie night, and I'll bake some hazelnut muffin, just as you like ;)"

Marcie smiled and replied with a quick: "Sure, count me in".

Before going into the shower, she looked with pride at her toned body. Gone were the high school days of chubby Marcie.
Then, a cold hand touched Marcie's shoulder, making the woman jolt.

"You should have seen your face" laughed a woman with short strawberry blonde hair and a couple of piercings on her left eyebrow. Despite her childish-looking face, she had a pretty muscular body.

"Chrysta! Dear God, never do it again" yelled Marcie before bursting into a laugh like her friend.

"This evening, Natalie, Paula and I are going to the Pink Dolphin for an appetizer, are you with us?"

Marcie was thoughtful, as she had just said "yes" to April, so Chrysta added with a wink: "Maybe there are Teddy and Lucio too"

That seemed much more tempting to Marcie but then considered how little time she had spent with April since her friend moved in, and declined: "Sorry, tonight I have already something in program with my roommates, how about tomorrow?"

"Ok, but don't you dare bail on us then" said Chrysta in a fake menacing tone.

"Don't worry, I swear it" said Marcie drawing a cross on her chest with her finger.

-----

When she came back, it was almost eight o'clock, and April was having her dinner shift.
May was playing video games as usual. After coldly greeting each other, Marcie shut in her own bedroom and turned on the pc to prepare the test until, a few hours later, she heard the entrance door opening. Since there wasn't much left for the test, she rushed typing the final questions.

"I'm home" said April's voice accompanied by the sound of steps.

"Hi, cousin, are you ready for tonight?" asked May pumping her fist.

"Sure, just give me a second and let me bake the muffins. The dough is ready, all I need to do is put them in the oven"

"Ok, meanwhile I'll start the movie" said May before turning off the console and connecting her computer at the tv screen.

"Where's Marcie? Hasn't she come back already?" asked the redhead once she had turned on the oven. She then remembered to have seen her jacket hanged next to the entrance door.

"That swot is locked in her bedroom" nagged May.

"That swot was doing her job!" bursted Marcie slamming her bedroom's door. "Unlike someone who doesn't have anything to do for all day!"

May snorted without replying back.

"Girls, please!" said April stomping a foot.

The two women turned their attention to her and the redhead put her hands on her mouth, as if she was sorry for what she did, then the moment of embarrassment passed and said: "Let's not quarrel over such things, instead enjoy this movie night as friendly roommates".

"Sure, April" said May, avoiding to give a nasty gaze toward Marcie.

The dark skinned woman nooded. "You're right, I'm sorry April"

The redhead clapped her hands together and smiled. "It's no problem! So, May, what movie do you suggest?"

"Either Mad Max or Beauty and the Beast" replied her cousin with a grin while opening the folder with the two downloaded movies.

"Two very similar movies" thought sarcastically Marcie.

"What do you prefer, Marcie?" Asked April taking a seat between the two. The couch wasn't well suited for three people, so they were squished between the armrests.

"Dunno... Let's go with the second" said the dark-skinned woman while squirming to free her right arm.

"Perfect!" exclaimed April as May started the movie.

-----

During the movie they remained quiet for most of the time, especially because not long after the muffins were ready and the three roommates were busy snacking on them. After an hour of so, May fell asleep, resting her head on April's shoulder. Marcie couldn't help but notice how Apri bursted into tears at the ending, just like with every romantic movie, and giggle at it.

"Well, it's always nice seeing Beauty and the beast" said Marcie with a yawn.

"I agree, especially when we're all together" commented April.

"Yeah, this was a nice idea, but now I really have to sleep, goodnight!" said Marcie but, after she stood up, April called her.

"Wait!" said the redhead, and she moved May's head from her shoulder to stay more comfortably.

"What is it?" Asked Marcie, hoping for a quick answer so she could finally go to her bed.

121341.content:
It was a sunny morning in Orcawood, and three ladies living in an apartment in Freshman Street 15 were just having breakfast. No one of them was a great cook, but they managed to handle it well. At the table there were two blondes. One with long curly hair, who was having a bowl with milk and corn flakes, and the other with her hair cut in a pixie bob, who was eating a buttered toast and some bacon. Those were, respectively, Margaret Mckenzie and Lily Monet.
Preparing some scrambled eggs was an half-japanese woman with black hair cut in a messy bob. She was Sakura Brown, and the owner of the apartment.

She received the apartment from an old aunt three years before, and decided to move in immediately while accepting the first job she found, which was as a clerk in a small discount in the suburb. After almost two years of living alone in such a large flat, she had grown bored of it, decided to rent it, so she could round out her salary too. There were two spare room, after all, if she moved some of the furniture in the living room and prepared two beds.

What Sakura didn't expect was to have such pretty women as roomates. Lily was tiny, cute as a button and had wide blue eyes that made her look like a childe, while Margaret had beautiful face features and a well defined figure. The asian girl considered herself very lucky, to the point she asked both of them half of the rent she initially wanted. There was only a problem, no one knew Sakura was a lesbian, and she was reluctant to confess her feelings to any woman in fear of being rejected, something very easy to happen when said woman probably had a different orientation.

"Hey, isn't today a beautiful day?" asked Sakura while sitting at the table with her breakfast.

Margaret glanced at the window. There wasn't a single cloud in the sky. "Yeah, so?"

"I think this evening we could go out for a walk in town centre, and maybe have a dinner in a nice place. Don't you agree?" proposed Sakura, she gleefully thought about going out with her roommates since her boss told her that day the market would've been closed for some restorations.

Lily nooded with a smile, while Margaret replied: "Do you know I have my job this afternoon, right?"

"Of course, of course, I mean after your job. You come home and we'll go or, if you prefer, Lily and I can wait for you outside the shop when your job is over"

"I don't know, I'll think about it" said Margaret before leaving and closing herself in the room.

Sakura sighed, and Lily put a hand on her shoulder.

"I-if you really want, we can go just the two of us, or you can also invite a friend of yours if you prefer" said the tiny blonde while her cheeks have become red. Lily was very shy, and Sakura remembered that the first week Lily moved in rarely uttered a word before she got used to her roomates.

Sakura's cheeks became red. "T-thanks, Lily" said before deciding to dedicate her attention toward the breakfast.

Lily smiled in reply, while placing the empty plate in the kitchen sink, and went to work in her room.

----

Sakura was in her room, drawing on a large paper a sensual woman, with long flowing hair and a skimpy dress. Sakura learned drawing with that style by copying some illustrations of comic book artist Milo Manara and in a couple of years she could copy effectively most of his drawings. Then she started making drawing on her own, quickly developing her own, albeith similar, style. One of the main difference one could find was that Sakura's women were much more rubenesque, as the half-Japanese woman loved adding some soft features and curves in the women she drew.
At one moment, Sakura could hear Margaret leaving for work, so she put the pencil in its place and hid the paper in the large drawer of the desk.

Sakura tied a bandana around her head went to the cabin in the hall and grabbed a feather duster a cloth and a degreaser.
"Let's start with the kitchen" said with the same determination of an action hero who was ready to face an entire army of zombies.

With a broom she swiped away the crumbs on the floor that resulted from that day's breakfast and lunch. Dammit, there were too many for her tastes, and she told her roomates many times to eat on the table!
She cleaned everything with the accuracy of the surgeon. The sink, the counter, even the windows. Everything had to shine. Lily tried to sneak into the kitchen but, noticing that Sakura was in the middle of a "cleaning craze" she went back to her bedroom unnoticed. During these moments, the best ideas was avoid to stay too close to Sakura and especially not leave the room for a while in the risk of slightly soiling something.

Then Sakura moved to the living room, and then to the bathroom, in the meanwhile, Lily decided to go for a walk in town with her camera, that way she couldn't have done anything that angered the clean freak of her roommate.

----

When she was done, Sakura had cleaned every inch of the house, except her roommates' bedrooms. As much as she was curious to visit them, she wanted to respect their privacy.
She sat on the armchair and turned on the tv, watching some local news and then switching to one of these shows where a hovel gets restructured and become a wonderful house. Sakura confronted the final result with her own apartment, and noticed it wasn't that different, albeit hers was much smaller. She was thankful her aunt had such good tastes in interior decoration.

Suddenly, Sakura felt a vibration in her pants: Lily had just sent her a message.

"Margaret told me she doesn't want to go out this evening. Do you wanna go just you and me?"

Sakura pouted. She would have really wanted to go out with Margaret, especially in the hopes of seeing her in that new dress Sakura just gave her for the blonde's birthday and, among the two roomates, she definitely did find Margaret the most attractive one, with her more defined curves and confident expression,while Lily was cute but too scrawny. However, the tiny blonde was so close to her... could it be... Thinking the possibility of Lily's liking her back, Sakura's heart skipped a beat. Then she shook her head, it was probably her immagination. Even still, it was rare for Sakura to have a free evening and she could not waste this chance.

She noticed it had been almost five minutes since she saw the text and hadn't replied yet, so she quickly texted...

121342.content:
Lily opened the pantry door. In front of her there was a dozen of biscuits boxes. She pondered and poked her tiny chin with her bony index before picking a box of chocolate wavers, then she cautiously closed the door and crossed the kitchen, making attention to not leave any mark on the clean and sparkling floor. Sakura, her roommate and owner of the apartment, must have cleaned it not much time before.

Lily was extra careful to check if Sakura was in the hall, if the half Japanese woman find out that she was snacking (and leaving crumbs!) in her room, it would probably anger her. Thankfully there was no trace of Sakura and the sounds coming from the living room implied she was watching the television, so Lily could safely go back to her room.

She sat comfortably on her desk chair, thanks to her short and petite frame she could even cross her legs, and began typing on the keyboard. Lily Monet was a young and small woman, with very long blonde hair and blue eyes. She was already small, but her habit of wearing oversized clothes to stay comfortable made her appear even smaller. At that moment, for instance, she was wearing a large yellow sweater and bright blue yoga pants.

Lily was of French origins, and had recently found a job in a large company, of which the blonde never remembered the name. That job was a blessing to her, all she had to do was check the daily mails and data and rearrange them and/or send them to the proper sector of the company, often acting as a kind of coordinator, all of this without leaving home. Being this one a big company, there was a lot of stuff to rearrange, but usually Lily managed to finish her work after three hours, leaving the rest of the day free and, even better, she could just work at home with her own pc.

When she was working, she usually ate an entire box of biscuits, she wasn't sure if it was to get the necessary energies, because she enjoyed their taste or simply to pass the time while she read through all the files she found. One thing was sure: her metabolism was efficient enough, therefore she had no fear of gaining a pound on her tiny frame.

----

Once work was finished, it was almost lunchtime, and when she went to the kitchen Sakura was beginning to prepare lunch.

"Hi, Lily, I was about to make some Onigiri, you wanna help me?" asked the half Japanese woman. She had black hair in a messy bob.

Lily nodded. She was a very shy girl, and rarely spoke, that was also another reason of why she liked her job so much, so that she couldn't interact a lot with other people. That always made her nervous.

The blonde loved Japanese food, especially stuff with rice like sushi or Onigiri, the latter was basically a meatball of rice with some raw fish inside. When she learnt that Sakura was able to cook it (thanks to her mom) , she went in ecstasy, and would've eaten Sakura's cooking every meal if it wasn't for the other roomate, Margaret, the other roommate, who didn't like sushi at all. Margsret even tasted a sushi roll but the taste of raw tuna repulsed her, so Sakura only prepared it whenever for lunch or dinner there are only Lily and her, and the tiny blonde was happy of that.

The two roomates cooked rice while chatting every once in a while, of course, Lily being extremely shy, Sakura did most of the talking while Lily replied with short words.

"Ok, all done! Enjoy" exclaimed cheerfully Sakura clapping her hands together as the two girls where sitting at the small glass table, a plate with some onigiris in the middle.

The two girls picked an onigiri each, and ate it. Lily loved it, and never dropped her smile as she chewed the ball of rice. Meanwhile, Sakura ate more slowly, she watched Lily happily eating the onigiri she made. The half Japanese woman found the tiny blonde very cute when she was eating.
Soon Lily finished her onigiri and stretched an arm to pick a second one but was hesitant. Her bright blue eyes gazed Sakura's.

"Sure, pick how many you want! There's alot of them and I'm not sure I can eat much more" said the dark-haired girl with a smile. Her cheeks have become red too but Lily, much to Sakura's relief, didn't notice it since she had immediately picked a second onigiri. And just as quickly, she picked a third, a fourth and so on until there were no more onigiris.

"Wow! You sure eat alot for being so tiny" commented Sakura "and cute" added in a whisper that Lily didn't hear.

The blonde girl blushed and smiled, not knowing how to reply. Did she ate a bit too much? Maybe she had been too greedy.

Noticing her roomate's embarrassment, Sakura said: "It's a sign you appreciate my work! If you like it so much, next time I can even make more. It's a shame Margaret doesn't like it, or we could enjoy these special sushi meals all together"

The black haired girl got up with an almost mechanical movement and started to clear the table. Lily looked at the clock and realized Sakura had work in an hour, so she helped her roommate.

"Thanks, Lily" said Sakura almost heartened, only to become suddenly strict: "Now, please, leave. I only have half an hour to make the kitchen shine" said as she gazed through the floor tiles in search pf rice grains and crumbs that had fallen.

Lily didn't reply back and quickly left the kitchen. Every "clean-craze" turned Sakura from a sweet roomate into a tyrant. The best way to deal with it was to go out for a while and the tiny blonde had developed the habit to go for a walk while taking photos of the town.

----

Lily walked down Freshman Street. It was close to the town centre but not enough to be caothic, with small trees on the sidewalks and fancy shops in every block. There was one which sold plushies of every kind and the girl was tempted to buy them, however she knew that if she had bought one she would've ended up buying all of them and estinguish all of her salary. Next there was a candy shop, where Lily bought a small bag of candy every day, including that one. That way she kept herself busy munching gummies before reaching the street next to the lake.
The blue water was shining under the sun, and some sailboats were racing from one side to another. Lily took multiple photos of these sailboats, especially the yellow one, since yellow was her favorite color. The she walked down the lakeshore, taking photos here and there. Despite being autumn, a few people still spent the evening next to the lake, a couple of them even daring to take a swim, including a young, muscular woman with short strawberry blonde hair.

----

Back home, Lily looked at the pictures she took on the pc and deleted the ones she didn't like, while suddenly the door opened and the tiny blonde closed the folders of the pc, leaving the screensaver with the image of a space-ship. The one who opened the door was Margaret. Like Lily, Margaret had blonde hair, but hers is wavy and longer, while her face was sharper and her body more curvaceous.

"I'm eating out with a friend, you're alone for dinner, ok?" said Margaret before closing the door without waiting for Lily's reply.

Lily was fine with that, as it meant she had all the house for herself for at least a couple of hours. She prepared everything: made some toasts with cheese, brought a package of biscuits, turned on the tv and the console and grabbed the joystick. Every night, Lily would spend hours playing videogames until she was too tired but most of the time there were her roomates, which meant she had to keep the volume low if not turning it off, instead that night she could hear the sound of her guns and her chainsaw mowing down dozens of zombies.
She noticed her videogames friend, Dark5Mistress, was online. Lily's codename was SummerT1me77 and she had been playing with Dark5Mistress every night since a couple of months before but, ironically, neither of them knew their videogames mate was living in the same building, with only a couple of walls between them.

Before deciding a game, a message appeared on a small window in the corner of the screen: "You already online?" asked Dark5Mistress.

"Yup" replied SummerT1me77. "Have you bought the new ZombiEmpire 3?" asked. She hadn't played it yet and was anxious to try it.

"Not yet, sorry. Wanna play Astro-Race?"

"Sure, why not?"

So Lily spent the next few hours playing videogames. She didn't hear Sakura coming home from home at half past midnight but neither did the half-Japanese woman hear the beeps of the spaceships racing through an asteroids field. Sakura was too sleepy and, with a zombiesque walk, went to her room and collapsed on the bed. After another half-hour, Lily felt tired and texted her friend she was going to sleep.

She put the bowl and the plate back to the kitchen and went to sleep after another usual day, with nothing particularly different. Margaret came home not long after Lily fell asleep.

The next day, however, happened something that would completely shake Lily's daily habits and her life:

The next day began like every other day. Lily woke up, had a quick breackfast and carried the usual box of biscuits in her room. However, when she entered in her company's website, she didn't find the usual mails and data, instead, there was only a single mail destined to Lily Monet.

"To me?" said the tiny blonde, still surprised. After months of doing the same work over and over, she didn't expect for the company to suddenly contact her. Did she do something wrong? Lily began to think of a possible mistake she could've made, maybe when she was thinking too much about the games she would've played later, or when she distracted herself for a moment whenever she picked a biscuit from the box.

"Well, there's only one way to find out" said Lily with a 'click' of her mouse. She put a biscuit in her mouth and read the opened mail:

"Dear Ms. Monet

We, of the Yeng Dinstribution, appreciate a lot the work you do and your constant efficiency, which we think should be of example to every worker of our company.
For this reason, we are offering you a promotion, which includes an higher pay and 20 days of vacation every year.
You are waited for a meeting at the Yeng Palace, this morning at 11.30 A.M, to learn and discuss about your new job.

Yeng Dinstribution staff manager, Miranda Mice"

Lily was reliefed. She had actually gotten a promotion. And did they really thought she was the ideal employee? For Lily, it wasn't even that difficult, and took up only the morning, in fact, she wasn't quite sure if that promotion was a good thing: what if she had to work more? What if it left her with barely any freetime?
If it was a good or bad thing, Lily would've learned about it in a couple of hours, at the meeting. Speaking of, the Yeng Dinstribution venue was in the business district, not exactly behind the corner, if she didn't want to arrive late, she had to move now.

----

Lily put the closest she found as formal clothes: a green shirt with a pair of black pants. The blonde was fond of wearing more comfortable clothes to stay at home, like oversized sweathers or t-shirts, and had to search through all of her guardrobe to find something decent for a job meeting.

After a little more than an hour (damned city roads too busy), Lily was in front of the palace of the Yeng Dinstribution. From what Lily knew, it was a subsidiary of the much larger Yeng Corporation.
Inside there was a large and bright hall, almost completely empty, save for a young woman at the reception and a couple of people sitting on a bench next to a wall.

Gathering all of her courage, Lily approached the receptionist.

"Hi, I have a me-meeting with the ma-manager" said with her high-pitched voice. Her face completely red.

The receptionist looked at her computer. "Lily Monet, right?"

Lily nooded.

The receptionist turned on a small microphone on the desk. "Mrs. Mice, Monet is here. Shall I..."

"Hohoh!" laughed a husky voice from the microphone. "Let her in now! I'm eager to meet her".

The secretary maintained her composture. "Seventh floor, at the end of the right hall" said quickly.

"Th-th-thanks" said Lily before running toward the elevator.

----

Lily was standing in front of a pair of large and wooden double doors. A plate confirmed it was the staff manafer's office. From the other side, she could hear some noises and the sound of unwrapped plastic bags. Lily knocked.

"Please, come in!" said a deep voice.

Miranda Mice, the manager, was the fattest person Lily had ever seen. Her body was almost completely round, her neckless head topped by some curly brown hair, while the desk was half-moon shaped to accomodate her gargantuan belly. A tent-sized red dress covered her body, while fat-chocked arms reached the bags frenchfries piled on the desk.

"Please, take a seat" said the manager, pointing at a chair in front of the desk.

Lily didn't react immediately, blocked by her shyness and the shock of seeing that landwhale, but then quickly ran toward the chair. These two women, sitting at the opposite sides of the desk, were completely opposite. One tiny and skinny, the chair almost too big for her, the other huge and wide.

Miranda glanced at the clock on the wall. "You've arrived twenty minutes ahead. I like this! It means you really take your commitments seriously" commented the massive manager. Red sauce dripping from her double chin.

"Th-thanks" said the blonde in a whisper.

"please, take some fries. It's almost lunchtime, you must be hungry".

For Lily, it was almost a couple of hours early for lunch, but didn't want to offend the manager. Besides, she was used to eat snacks in the morning, so she picked one of the many French fries bags.

"Today there was a special offer at "Fried kingdom", so I ordered quite a few" commented Miranda with a laugh.

Lily looked at the graveyard of empty packages piled on a corner of the desk.

"Please, try them with this sauce" said Miranda moving a glass close to Lily, or at least, as close as she could before her belly was pressed against the desk.

Inside there was the red sauce that smeared Miranda's double chin, it was similar to ketchup, but of a brighter color and a denser appearance. Lily poured a French fry and tasted it. The flavour sent fireworks inside her tastebuds and the tiny blonde couldn't wait to pour a second french fry.

Miranda smiled behind her hands while she saw Lily's happy expression. "Really good, isn't it? It's one of our latest products".

Lily stopped to pour french fries in the sauce and eat them.

The large woman cleared her throat before explaining: "The Yeng Corporation make products of every kind for the people all around the globe. The Yeng Dinstribution doesn't have the same influence of variety of products, and specializes in food. Mostly snacks but also special ingredients and crops".

Lily kept nooding at every word. Thinking back, many of the mails she had to arrange was about food orders and/or production.

Miranda gulped down a mouthful of fries. "At the moment we make products dinstributed in Valentine and the neighboring towns, ingredients for the restaurants, products for the markets... Stuff like that. Your new job, if you accept it, will be very important and closely related to our products... "

Lily gulped, hoping it won't be something too demanding.

Miranda spilled the remaining fries in her mouth and threw away the empty pacage. "Your new job," said between munches, "is to..."

121343.content:
A young woman was looking at the mirror. She had long, wavy blonde hair tied into a ponytail and bright green eyes. He mouth was widened in a 32-teeth smile as she gazed herself with the leopard print vest, which left the belly-button exposed, the short black skirt and the stockings, all of these clothes emphasized her slim body, something she was quite proud of.
Unfortunately for her, a voice interrupted that moment.

"Margaret, you know those clothes are for sale, don't you?" asked sarcastically an indian woman who was standing behind the cash desk.

"Yes, I know, Kyra" hissed Margaret to the colleague who had just broken her moment of dream.

The blonde quickly changed back into her ugly black uniform.

"Just a couple of months ago, if I wanted, I could've bought half of the stuff in sale here" thought with pique as she remembered the day her parents told her she needed to "grow up" and sent her in that crappy town with "only" a couple of thousands of bucks. She even thought she had been lucky at finding a job in Orcawood's largest clothing shop, but it actually meant she had to spend all day with clothes she could never buy with her miserable salary.
And to add insult to the injury, she saw many women who could afford these fashionable clothes, some of which Margaret thought they didn't have the right body to give those clothes justice. Of course, that's not getting to the fact that said shop had a plus size section, meaning they often have overweight women who apparently preferred buying a new pair of pants rather than losing a few pounds.
Margaret, instead, had the perfect body, with no sign of fat or cellulite, no muffing top, not even a scar, and yet she could only assist these fat women and even had to compliment them whenever they asked for an opinion.

Thankfully, other five minutes and she would've been free.

Margaret was resting her head between the crossed arms on the cashier desk.

"Hey, Kyra", she called her colleague.

The raven-haired woman was busy reordering some pair of jeans by size, with no answer to the blonde.

"Kyra!" called with a higher tone.

After the third call, Kyra replied. "What is it?"

"Do you happen to know any nice place on the street next to the lake?"

"It depends, are you going with someone?" asked the Indian woman placing an hand on her svelte hips.

"Yes" replied bluntly the blonde girl, to make clear she wouldn't have answered who was she going out with.

Kyra scratched her nose. "There's the Pink Dolphin, which is a nice pub if you're going out at late night, or just have a walk on the docks and you'll check by yourself. There's even a nice ice-cream shop, but I guess it doesn't suit your tastes, does it?"

"Exactly" replied Margaret, who at that point was checking the clock every few seconds, until her turn was finally over.

"Ok, see ya tomorrow! Thanks Kyra" said while hastily putting on the jacket, she needed to hide her uniform, and leave the shop.

"You're welcome" replied her colleague before the blonde closed the door behind her.

----

Even before reaching her apartment's door, she could already hear the sound of the vacuum cleaner. She opened the door with caution and removed the shoes to wear a pair of frilly slippers. She hated these ugly slippers, but it was an ironclad rule set by Sakura Brown, her roomate and owner of the apartment, therefore neither she nor Lily could object to it.

Sakura was too busy removing the dust under the couch and the armchair to notice the blonde arriving and going into her room.
Margaret removed that hateful uniform as if it was constricting her, and put on some comfortable (and decent) clothes before laying on her bed to chat on the phone some friends.

After an half hour, Sakura opened the door.

"Hello, Margaret! You could've told me you've arrived" said the half-Japanese woman.

The blonde put the phone on the bedside table. "How did you notice?"

Sakura pointed at the slippers next to the bed. "I saw they were missing" explained with a laugh. "I'm going for the groceries. We're almost out of fruit, milk, bubble bath and most important, degreaser. You wanna come with me?" asked with her eyes pointed to the ceiling and while twirling a lock of hair.

"No, I'm tired at the moment. Why don't you ask Lily?"

"Fine" said Sakura with disappointment as she closed the door.

----

Margaret spent the rest of the evening while surfing on the net, until she decided to have a bath.
During the walk to the bathroom, she saw the other roomate, Lily, sneacking from the kitchen with a box of oreos under her arm. The tiny blonde asked the taller blonde to don't tell anyone putting her finger on the lips, and Margaret shrugged her shoulders.

Meanwhile, Sakura was in her room, the door wide open, drawing with pastels, but Margaret could not see nor she was interested to know what it was, she just wanted to relax in the bathub.
Her body warmed by the water, soft bubbles around her and the feeble light of the lamp. That was one of the few moments when Margaret felt as if she had the same life of before her parents neglected her the money. Next to the bathub, the timer was set at one hour, an hour of pure bliss for the woman.

Unfortunately, Sakura knocked the bathroom door before that hour was over. She knocked a second time, louder, to have a reply from the blonde.

"Gimme a minute" said Margaret emerging from the water.

"No, wait, I don't have to use the bathroom" explained quickly Sakura, unnerving the blonde. "I just wanted to ask you if you have some suggestion for this dinner. If you want I can tell you what there's in the pantry and in the fridge".

Margaret cocked an eyebrow. "Tonight I eat out" replied quickly.

Sakura gulped. "Really? And with whom, may I ask?"

"It's not your business" said bluntly the blonde before submerging herself again in the bathub.

----

Turning to look back at her reflection, Parker failed to see the stunner that always stared right back at her. Staring daggers at the Adonis-like figures still going at it like they had been doing this forever, Parker looked for an unoccupied target.

Immediately the Armenian bombshell hopped back on one of the treadmills. At least this way she could take out some aggression! Turning it up way higher than she should have, Parker began a quick jog. Unimpressed with the machines speed, she cranked it up further. Now she was really running!

Then, it came back to her, the pain, and the aches. Wincing her teeth in agony, Parker tried to fight through it; big mistake.

At first Parker thought the slightly blurred vision was due to sweat getting in her eyes; so she tried to shake it off. Then her chest felt like it had gone up in flames, but still she tried to power through. Then…

*crack*

*Thud thud*

In one bleary-eyed moment, Parker had misplaced her right foot and put all her weight on it. From there it seemed like forever to her, but to the startled onlookers it was merely two seconds. Parker’s body went careening straight down to the cycling rubber, her chin hitting it with a dull *crack*. From there her body, no longer running to keep up with the treadmill, was flung backwards across the room; her body hitting the back wall with considerable force.

Parker’s world was spinning; she could barely see the figures rushing over to see what had happened. She could just barely make out what they were saying.

“Oh my god!”

“Is she alright?”

“I am sure those melons broke her fall…”

“Karen! That’s mean!”

“Ms are you ok?”

“Ugh” Parker mumbled, clutching one hand to her head as the other braced the wall, forcing herself to stand up; but it was not going to happen. “ARGH!” Parker shrieked as when she put her weight onto that same right foot that had collapsed beneath her. She slid back down, looking up at her limb.

It was covered in red markings and carpet burns, but her ankle looked twisted completely out of place.

“Someone call 911!” one of the onlookers stated as another person arrived with an ice pack, placing it gingerly on the damaged leg. Some of the gym staff had arrived on the scene too, one starting to apply basic first aid while the other barked instructions.

“Okay, everyone back up!” he called out, “Cho keep her awake, do NOT let her fall asleep!” he added, looking over his shoulder at the medic taking care of Parker, trying to ask her details to make sure she remained conscious.

Ugh, couldn’t she go away? It was hard enough to think straight without her asking all these silly questions.

“I think she has concussion” the Chinese –American woman noted, seeing how Parker’s eyes couldn’t focus on her own, “Call an ambulance.”

Parker barely noticed more people arrive, a stretcher coming out. Or hell, even being placed on it; as she slowly slipped out of consciousness.

“What’s that Porter?” Parker inquired, trying to peer over the lid as the black-clad Nurse opened it.

“Call me Cer” she hand-waved, “And this is just a snack, running around all day is tiring, so I bring these every morning” at this Cer turned the box around to reveal a very large, half finished, box of donuts. “Want one? I can’t have too many, might ruin my figure...” the spherical nurse added with no sense of irony what-so-ever.

“Sure…” Parker relented; she might need something to cheer her up. To pass the time, the pair began to share donuts and chat; with the overfed nurse pulling up a very sturdy chair to rest her monumental backside on. It turned out that while they had little in common; Cer was not all that bad a person to talk to, hell they both shared a snarky sense of humour at least.

Parker was too shocked to explain that it was her first time, also it would have ruined the façade of her being some healthy go-getter she had going here. So instead she spluttered out without thinking; “You go to the gym?”

This seemed to strike a nerve.

Nurse Porter stopped shoveling back the doughnut that was on its way to meet its fellows and placed it back in the bow. She turned her gaze upwards and stared daggers at Parker. “Look, I know I am fat, hell I am way beyond just fat anymore, but I know that if I don’t exercise like crazy and eat right then I will be even fatter before I can blink…these donuts? Before she could make any further judgments, a rumble heralded the return of the not-so-jovial nurse.

"Parker, would you mind stepping into my office when you get the chance?" she asked, touching the slick veneer with three fingers and leaning in slightly, "No rush. Finish what you're doing and then you can just come on in."

And although it was made to look innocent, like Carol had just stopped to say hello or to perhaps reschedule an appointment, everyone else on the floor knew that something was up. And as Carol sauntered down the central aisle, created by cubicles and desks, everyone did their best to contain their various reactions.

It was no secret that Parker and Carol had developed some bad blood in the short time that they had become acquainted. Their quiet feud had been broadcast in hushed tones and whispers, with some giggling and shushing, all across the office building. Just about everyone knew that Parker was a shitty secretary. But now everyone knew that Parker was a shitty secretary and her ass was about to be grass. And that proved to be infinitely more entertaining conversation.

Somewhere in the office, Pam was practically drooling. Katie was already texting "SHOTS FIRED!!!" to Pam. Brooke was already smirking in satisfaction of knowing that skinny bitch was on her way out. Even Becky couldn't help but wonder if she'd make a good replacement for Parker...

***


"You, uh... you wanted to see me?"

Carol let out a tight stream of air from the o of her mouth.

"Yes dear." she said, channeling her mother, "Please, come take a seat."

Parker, for once, did what she was told. The gravitas of the situation had, apparently, not been lost on her. For the first time since Carol had arrived, Parker was sitting up straight. She still looked distasteful, an air of unpleasantness about her. But she was at least attempting to control her resting bitch face with some passing success. She sat in the chair opposite Carol's, one leg over the other, and held onto her knee. Her skirt was tight and small.

"Parker... do you want to be here?" Carol asked, pyramiding her fingers thoughtfully, "And I mean here as in the company, not here as in my office. I'm completely aware that you'd probably much rather be back at your desk."

"I dunno." Parker bounced her prominent black eyebrows, "It's nice in here."

"Yes... it is nice, isn't it?" Carol extended a hand in gesticulation, "And do you know how I got here? By applying myself."

There. That right there, Carol reminded herself as she caught that sly little eye roll, that was why she was in here.Parker had no respect for her job, this company, or her.

"Parker, I'm not going to beat around the bush." Carol's tone turned stern and her hands folded on top of the desk in front of her. She hunched slightly into her burgundy blazer. Her shoulders hiked up and her brow furrowed—she looked rather menacing, "I know you're on your phone all the time. I know you're rude to clients. I know you "lose" half of your paperwork because you're lazy and, frankly, irresponsible. I know all of these things because I'm your boss. And if you'd like for me to stay your boss—"

Here Parker looked to have wanted to say something, but wisely decided against it. The small break in her stoic lack of upset was enough to let Carol know she pushed a button. At least she wasn't a crier.

"—or remained employed at this company," Carol corrected, "then I suggest you take me very seriously when I say this is your last chance, Parker. If you don't shape up, I will fire you. Are we understood?"

The surly twenty-something took a deep sigh, her huge chest inflating and deflating in defeat. God those things were huge. But ultimately the stunning secretary relented.

"Yeah." Parker nodded with a more pronounced frown, "I got it."

"Good, then you're dismissed." Carol smiled tightly as Parker eagerly removed herself from her seat, "The next time I have to call you in here, it better be because I have a question about an appointment. You got it?"

"Sure mom." Parker said mockingly to the door.

"What was that?" Carol arched her eyebrows threateningly

"Sure boss." Parker corrected as she shut the door behind her, and got back to work.

133.content:
Little Bake Shop on Main is the brainchild of two would-be entrepreneurs. They're both young, but they're hungry!

Hopefully just metaphorically—it's not like they can afford any excess snacking...


***


RONNIE WILSON—


Is at the heart of this operation. She's been baking since she was a little girl, growing up in the Heights. Her Mom and Dad had always told her that it was dumb of her to even try to build up a store from the ground up. Well look at her now, Mr. & Mrs. Wilson!
She's... in just as much financial trouble as they said she'd be.

What could it be? It wasn't like she wasn't trying! She was trying, like, so hard you guys. Maybe people just didn't like her cooking?

Ronnie's been big her entire life. After a stint in Buttercombe Academy, where she learned about her passion of pastries and put on much more than the freshman fifteen, she's bigger than ever and dying to break even. Between getting the store up and running, regular deliveries of supplies and paying her business partner Penny, this chubby Chernobyl of energy might just go out forever if she can't make her dream of owning a successful bakery come true!


PENNY SIMON—


Is the brains behind a lot of this. Whereas she respects her co-founder, Ronnie, and her much more overt passion for this endeavor, Penny is a bit more practical. It's been like that ever since they were kids. These two go way back, but trying to run this store in a direction that isn't "into the ground" might just ruin that friendship for good.

The truth is, Penny's just not a "creative" type. She's a realist. A number cruncher. All this baking stuff, decorating and embellishing... it isn't her.

Penny's pretty on the ropes about this whole thing, but they're doing it. She's never really liked sweets before, but she has to admit, Ronnie's stint in that Academy and being away at Culinary School has really helped her see the light. If Penny's not careful, she's going to get much more than a sugar high—she might walk away with a fully-fledged gut, courtesy of one Ronnie Wilson!

1332.content:
Little Bake Shop on Main.

It didn't exactly sound imposing, but then again, Ronnie didn't want it to.

"You don't get it, Penny!" the big brunette had said what seemed like forever ago, during the design of the awning, "I don't want it to sound like anything else. I just want it to be a cute little bakery. You don't get customers—or friends—by being mean, Penny. You get them by being nice, friendly, and humble!"

This little nook carved out into an old brick building wasn't much. Unless you thought "overdoing it on the white and pink" counted as much. Ronnie had been involved pretty heavily in the design and, even though Penny had okayed it, she couldn't help but feel like she was getting involved in a huge disaster.

This part of town, this atmosphere, this economy, this fucking shade of pink, none of it made Penny Simon feel like she was making a sound business investment. Or better yet, playing with her inheritance wisely. How many businesses failed within their first year of opening? Like, 80% or something, right? Those numbers didn't exactly play into Penny's chintzy senses well, and she had been up all night... well, all week in anticipation for their first day of business.

And lo and behold, despite all the ads she had put in the paper, the flyers she had literally thrown into the wind across town, and begging all of her friends to like their page on Social Media, they had seen a very modest success.

It hurt her to see Ronnie so glum.

But it hurt her wallet more.

"I told you this was a dumb idea." Penny said, her hands on her hips, "We shouldn't have made it a big deal to be like we're open! We should have just always acted like we were open. Y'know, like we've always been here."

"How is that helpful?" the normally cheerful Chernobyl of energy rolled her eyes from behind her glasses, "Maybe if you hadn't have scared those kids off—"

"They were, like, sixteen." Penny cut in, "They should have been in school, and were skipping. What 16 year old walks into a bakery at noon on a Monday?"

"Me." Ronnie struck defiantly against her childhood friend.

Penny didn't doubt that. She had known Ronnie since they were kids, and she'd always been big. Her time at that Academy up in Virginia had done a number on her figure for sure, but Penny couldn't remember a time when Ronnie was under at least two hundred pounds. At twenty five, Ronnie weighed more than two hundred and seventy pounds. So it wasn't hard for Penny to believe that Buttercombe Academy had been nothing but bakeries.

"You could have let them buy something." Ronnie almost whined, "Now we're those two mean old ladies who scared off a bunch of kids."

"Like two kids."

"We scared two kids!"

"And we're not old."

She wasn't! Despite what those kids had called her as she (quite literally) chased them out of the store. Penny looked even younger than Ronnie, despite being a year or so older than her. It helped that she was shorter. Her stylist said that the bob made her look older, but even Penny didn't buy that. Though at this rate, with all this stress, Penny was going to wrinkle up like a prune with worry lines. There just had to be something that they could do to help pick up business!

"Just... ugh..." Penny let out a steady stream of air, "I'm gonna take a walk. Clear my head."

"You... you sure?" Ronnie asked, sounding petrified by being left alone in what was so far a failing dream, "I mean..."

Ronnie seemed to shrink into her meaty shoulders, twiddling her fat fingers over the swell of her big belly.

"Yeah, I'm okay." Penny smiled tensely, "Maybe I'll get the chance to pound the pavement. You know, get the word out there..."

Penny quickly turned around to look at the woman, and she saw that she was a rather short woman with pink hair and a ponytail, and while she was somewhat chubby around her midsection and breasts, the rest of her body looked thin and lithe.
